column4: is there a command line tool for managing service to start on boot
other that update-rc.d looking for something a bit more user friendly for customers
you need universe, do the above to set up things correctly
is that thing telling me how to do it via a gui or somthing...
then look for the lines ending in universe, and uncomment them. Also, add the word multiverse there at the end of those lines
a sec, I'll put up a complete set
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/55666/  I'm using a local mirror, you can adapt them to us.archive if you like
thats a huge ass list of sources
they could be consolidated into about 6-8 lines, but this is how ubuntu releases them
and they are all from ubuntu, no third party
if you didn't care for rcconf, you might try sysv-rc-conf or sysvconfig
and for future ref, ubuntu doesn't really differentiate between runlevels a la redhat
